Posts.Content: Hi Calador, Thank you for your response. I will indeed keep everyone updated. I really hope I have a reduction in the pain as my hands are terribly painful. A friend who is a Pharmacologist said it's the fillers they use that cause the problems, we shall see! I spoke to my Chemist yesterday and Interestingly, the Letrozole range start at £1.67 and the Femara are £118.00!! How can there be such a difference, and I do wonder how they can make such a drug and retail them for £1.67. Hope your appointment goes ok, it is a benefit to have someone with you, I always feel stronger and more in control if hubby comes with me, on the one occasion he couldn't I felt undermined. So good luck. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Letrozole/Femara

Posts.Content: Hi Boobylou, Thank you for your reply. I've tried Cipla and Accord so I'm going to try the Femara as a trial for 3 months.  It's going to be expensive on going but will be worth it if fewer or no side effects.  When I took mine in the evening I was awake until early hours, it used to switch my brain on! Now take at lunch time. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Letrozole/Femara

Posts.Content: Hi Calador, You can ask your GP Practice not to send it to the Chemist, that way you have your prescription in your hand and can try different Chemist's. My husband does this with his Parkinson meds and GP Practice has obliged. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Letrozole/Femara

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, Thank you for your reply and link, which I have now looked at. I can't believe the price difference between manufacturers ie Dr Reddy 28 tablets £73.13 vs Accord 28 tabs £1.78!  Why, I wonder? Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Letrozole/Femara

Posts.Content: So today I found out via my Oncologist that my GP Practice are unable to prescribe Femara as it is not on their Formulary? GP had written to my Oncologist saying I had asked for the Femara.  Not sure what Formulary actually means in terms of prescribing.  My painful hands just seem to get worse, so I have decided to fund the Femara for 3 months to see if the pain eases off, if it does I'll probably carry on buying them, although I'm shocked at the price. It does seem to be a Post Code lottery!
Posts.Title: Letrozole/Femara

Posts.Content: Thanks for that extra info, it all helps so much. But so wish we didn't have this worry! Take Care. xx
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hi GC Thank you for your reply, I'm always keen to hear from anyone else not being given Chemo. RT Boosts are an interesting one to me too, not sure who gets them?  I agree further down the road is a concern but new stuff is being developed all the time and they have told me Breast Cancer is the most developed and researched of all Cancers in the last 10 years. Take Care, Sharon. xx
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hi GC I just looked at your profile which is not recent but I also had no Chemo, which is a worry to me with what was a 4.5CM tumour and in lymph nodes! Was your lymph node a 4mm or 0.4mm? xx Sharon. xx
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hi Marie, Thank you for this information, it's really useful and I will certainly ask GP for the UK brand. Hope you continue to improve. Best Wishes for 2019. Sharon.
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Thanks for that extra info, it all helps so much. But so wish we didn't have this worry! Take Care. xx
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hi Gincarla, I've been on the Cipla and feel exhausted, for first couple of months seemed ok but for last 6 weeks or so I feel exhausted and crippled with pain in my hands, to add to it all they seem to be lowering my mood! I'm off to GP in New Year to ask for Femara, I think it will be a bit of a challenge to get it but worth trying. I've noted this is a regular Topic on the Forum. Sharon.
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hi GC Thank you for your reply, I'm always keen to hear from anyone else not being given Chemo. RT Boosts are an interesting one to me too, not sure who gets them?  I agree further down the road is a concern but new stuff is being developed all the time and they have told me Breast Cancer is the most developed and researched of all Cancers in the last 10 years. Take Care, Sharon. xx
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki, How are things with you, have you had your Op and treatment plan? Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki, I'm doing ok thank you. Letrozole and Bisphosphonates for me. Well sooner rather than later is good for your Op! Keep me posted with your results and way forward. Best Wishes and hope all goes well. Sharon.
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki, No, I've met with a brick wall I'm afraid, in Sheffield they are sticking with micromets don't need a full clearance. My OncoType DX results came back with a low score of 9 so no Chemo either now, I've been so worried and wishing not done Onco Test then might have done the Chemo. What a nightmare. Are you doing Chemo? Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Hi Nicki, I wondered what did you decide to do regarding the Nodes, clearance or Rads ans Hormones? Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki, I have same concerns regarding could there be more disease in other nodes. I had Mastectomy and SLNB 2 Micromets found each 1mm, I have asked for a clearance due to my huge concerns, my Surgeon has said NICE Guidelines say he can't do a clearance for micromets, I am in Sheffield. I am on Letrozole and had Chest Wall Radiotherapy. I agree should be fine is not enough, I've been told to stop worrying about the Nodes it will be OK!! Do you know is the larger met a micro or macro? What part of the Country are you in cause if you could be offered a clearance I will seek further advice as I've been told NO! Take Care. Sharon.
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki, It is difficult to take info in sometimes, they will write it down if you ask, I have done. I would be interested to know as I want the out, out. out!! Take care. Sharon. xx
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Hi Bobbie, I think it's quite normal. I feel like that at times, in fact I posted on here only about a week ago something very similar to you. This site is brilliant though and helps a lot, makes you feel that you are well supported. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Feeling sad

Posts.Content: Hi Haysie, Oh I'm so sorry you are going through this again, no wonder your head is spinning.  It's so upsetting when treatment plan is changed, it seems to send us into a panic, it certainly did me. I can't really offer any advice as no experience with your current tumour type, I'm sure someone will come along to advise you, the Chemo will give you protection, Oncologist will advise. Thinking of you and sending love.
Posts.Title: Treatment plan changed

Posts.Content: Hi Galligirl, Thank you for putting the search details in, I forgot about that aspect! xx
Posts.Title: Cancer Blog

Posts.Content: Hi Shieldscannylass, I quite understand where you are coming from, people have said the same to me and at times it's irritated and upset me, I've thought unless you've been there maybe it's difficult to understand, although before my diagnosis and treatment I have been in the position of talking to people either who have been diagnosed with a serious illness or lost someone to an illness and I've always tried to be supportive and been careful which words I've used, but we are all so different and some people just don't understand.  Even family can be unsupportive and expect you just to move on, if only it was that easy. As you say this site is there for us all. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Hi youngat heart, I had to prize every piece of information out of my Surgeon, I still don't know whether it is Luminal A or B. We asked him about the shape of it as it was 4.5CM and I'm a 32B size I was scared it was so big and wanted to know whether it was long and thin or round, he didn't answer, even though we asked twice. Then I was worried about SNB missing some positive nodes that might have been left behind, again no answer!  Said I wanted too much detail. Oncologist was more forthcoming with info and easier to talk to but I think its a fine balance for them between frightening you more by telling you all the details or keeping you in the dark to a degree so they are more in control. For me personally I usually like detail but in this situation I move between wanting more info and then thinking it may be best not to know. I really don't think they have all the answers either because Cancer can be so unpredictable and they are constantly learning. Your BCN may be able to help if you want more detail. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: How much information should you be told

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, I'm hoping it's ok to put this useful Blog information on the Forum, some of you might know of it. I've been following Liz O'Riordan, she is a Breast Cancer Consultant who was diagnosed with BC and had a recurrence a couple of years after, her Blog is great and she provides some very useful up to date information. She also has a Twitter site.
Posts.Title: Cancer Blog

Posts.Content: Hi Ginacarla, Your post has made me think, because I have had shoulder blade pain (same side as Mastectomy) and spine for couple of weeks, worse at night, which has made me wonder could it be connected to BC/mastectomy, I'm on Femara.  Let us know the outcome please.
Posts.Title: back pain and anastrozole

Posts.Content: I've had a really stressful day worrying about the size of the Tumour 4.5cm and 2 micromets, all gone after Mastectomy and SLNB no clearance as they were micromets, but can't stop myself worrying that I haven't had Chemo, had several discussions with the Medics who said it wasn't of benefit 4% with Predict and weighing up the risks, Low OncoType DX Score 9 they asked me to read the TransATAC Study, said it would help me stop worrying so much. I did read it but now I've found out it didn't look at micromets and their significance. One good day seems to be followed by a worrying day when I just can't get myself thinking positively. Sharon.
Posts.Title: Worried again!

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady, I just looked at your Profile. Did you just have the one dose of Chemo? I love your upbeat attitude! Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Worried again!

Posts.Content: Hi Sim14, I'm sorry to read about your diagnosis, it is a very scary time when you receive the diagnosis and it is quite overwhelming. Once you get all your results and know the treatment plan it helps. I hope you have got plenty of support around you?  This site is invaluable and you will get lots of support from the ladies, so keep posting. There is also the Macmillan Helpline, that's a really good service too and they have lots of experience and take the time to talk with you at your own pace, when I rang them a couple of times, they never rushed me. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer at 28

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a Mastectomy and SLNB there were 2 micromets which were removed, I have asked my Surgeon what else can be done as I'm concerned there may be more undetected, he say's he can't do anymore as they were micromets and he has to follow NICE guidelines. I would appreciate any info regarding micromet treatment, they have said Chemo is little benefit to me and the risks outweigh the benefits. Sharon.
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: Hi Jacmatholmad thank you for your reply. Good to hear no further Nodes tested positive for you, that's what I am worried about there might be others left behind! I have certainly been through mental torment regarding the Chemo risks for such a low benefit. Had chest Wall RT. Hoping your results come back with good news, the waiting game is awful. x
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: hi, Thanks for your reply, that's interesting you were told micromets are classed as negative. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: Hi Whitby, I had Chest Wall Radiotherapy following a Mastectomy for a 4.5CM Grade 2 Ductal with no Boost, it was never mentioned and at the time I wasn't really aware of a Boost and still don't know when they decide the Boost is necessary. It's all a concern BC and every time something changes in the treatment plan its more anxiety. Breast Nurse should be able to answer some or all of the questions you have, if not you could ask to speak to the Oncologist again. Best Wishes.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy...no boost doses

Posts.Content: Hi Helen, They now do OncoType DX for Positive Nodes up to I think 3 being involved. Micros are classed as Negative in some Health Authorities and not others, where I live in Sheffield they are counted as Negative, just to add to the frustration of it all!! There is a good Blog written by a Breast Surgeon who has Breast Cancer, in her Team they are counted as Negative. She is called Liz O'Riordan, the Blog is worth looking at. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: Hi GC, Thank you for your reply. Did you have all the Nodes taken out? I am waiting for OncoType DX Results, already had Radiotherapy to Chest Wall and awful side effects ie Skin was badly blistered which then became infected needing to be dressed by Practice Nurse every other day, however, that's now ok. I'm on Letrozole and Bisphosphonates.   They did Predict Tool with me. It is a concern to me that it was in the Nodes, even though the Drs say it was micro and not to worry!! Best wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: Hi Helen, I just read your profile, and noticed you said Grade 2 and then further down 3, did the Onco type move you up to the next grade?xx Sharon. xx
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: Hi Alice, It depends on the size of the cancer in the Lymph Nodes and how many are involved, if the cancer is up to 2mm in the nodes then they are considered micro-mets.
Posts.Title: Sentinel node positive

Posts.Content: Hi Horsing Around, Oh, it was so good to receive your reply as you are having the same positive then negative times as I am! I'm ok one day and then the next at an all time low and feeling like I just can't cope. Also, you are not having a Clearance and neither did I, although I asked them if they could go back and take more as I really struggled feeling there might be more micromets left behind, it was a NO!  Are they doing RT to the whole Axilla? I see him every day AM and PM but he's retired from riding now due to hind end Arthritis, so he's walked out in hand!! Regularly told by passers by to buy a Dog, Ha Ha! I also have a Dog but she wouldn't walk out with him. He is so good for me, Horses can calm the soul. Take Care and keep in touch. xx
Posts.Title: results after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Pia, Lovely photograph of the Horses, she looks great! Sounds like you have some good friends watching over her in your absence. Will do you go to see her this w/end. I'll send you a pic of my Boy some time. Take care and please keep me posted, I feel it 's good to hear how other people are coping. Sharon.xx
Posts.Title: results after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Horsing Around, So sorry to hear of your results, I too had micromets 1mm each, do you know if they are going to do a clearance? It is a huge shock and for me I was very fit, a Horse, a Dog and love gardening so lots of physical work but still it strikes! It takes some coping with and I am up and down trying to get my head around it, this site helps no end. Keep me posted. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: results after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn I was on the low side at diagnosis, my Oncologist advised I take 25ug per day, I buy them in Boots, he said most people in the UK would be low as we don't get enough sun!  Whether low Vit D links to Breast Cancer I don't know. Best Wishes.
Posts.Title: vitamin D - who knows their vitamin D levels are low ?

Posts.Content: Hi Haysie, I notice you had OncoType DX test last time and had a low score, quite worrying Cancer may be back with your low score. Concerns me too as my score was low. Sharon. xx
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi Winney, I'm due to have a 2nd CT Lung scan, 1st one showed up something indiscriminate but to be certain they are doing 3 more at 4 monthly intervals, which they think will prove to be nothing, I hope they are right. I was told whoever/whatever part of the body they scan they are likely to see something that is not significant and this increases as we age. Best Wishes, Sharon.
Posts.Title: Possible node

Posts.Content: Hi Haysie, I'm so sorry to read this. It's scary and exhausting physically and mentally first time round but to go through it again so soon is awful. You will manage it but it will take great strength and test you yet again. Keep us posted. I will be thinking of you and your family. Sending Best Wishes Sharon.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time
